intro: Fagara avicennae, commonly known as the Caribbean arrowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean region, including parts of the Greater Antilles and the Bahamas. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal hammocks and forest understories. Fagara avicennae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
